intro: Adenocalymma ackermannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers bright, indirect light. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Adenocalymma ackermannii is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments.
